bill_title: permit certain persons holding a restricted driving permit to operate a motor vehicle for an extended period of time.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit certain persons holding a restricted driving permit to operate a motor vehicle for an extended period of time. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person with a restricted minor's permit may submit an application to the county sheriff requesting the sheriff to extend the hours from 5:00 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. for which such person may operate a motor vehicle. The sheriff shall consider the circumstances for the request and determine the necessity of extending the hours for operating a motor vehicle beyond the time constraints provided in chapter 32-12. The only circumstances that the sheriff may consider are school activities and employment. The sheriff shall notify the Department of Commerce and Regulation if an application has been approved. The Department of Commerce and Regulation may promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, prescribing an application and determining the information required to submit an application and the documentation given to the applicant to provide evidence that the application has been approved. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit certain persons holding a restricted driving permit to operate a motor vehicle for an extended period of time. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-12-12 be amended to read as follows: 32-12-12. A restricted minor's permit may be issued, upon application and payment of the proper fees as provided in § 32-12-16, to a minor at least fourteen years of age but less than eighteen years of age who has successfully passed all applicable tests and completed the requirements of an instruction permit as provided in § 32-12-11 or 32-12-11.1 and has not been convicted of a traffic violation during the past six months. For any such minor who has successfully completed a driver education course that has been approved by the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs or a driver education course that the secretary of commerce and regulation has determined has been approved by a state government agency in another state, the required minimum time period for holding the instruction permit in order to qualify for the restricted minor's permit is ninety continuous days. A restricted minor's permit entitles the holder, while having the permit in immediate physical possession, to operate a motor vehicle during the hours of 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. standard time if the motor vehicle is being operated with the permission of the holder's parents or guardian and during the hours of 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. if the motor vehicle is being operated under the direction of the holder's parent or guardian who is occupying a seat beside the holder. A restricted minor's permit holder is entitled to operate a motor vehicle during the hours of 8 p.m. to 11 p.m. standard time if the motor vehicle is being operated with the permission of the holder's parents or guardian and the holder is taking the most direct route home from school or work. The restrictions as to time of operation and operation under the direction of a parent or guardian do not apply to the holder of a valid restricted minor's permit operating a self-propelled agricultural machine which is not subject to registration under chapter 32-5.
